definitions.definition: an extremely large number of things or people

examples.text: These elements can be combined in a multitude of different ways.
The region attracts tourists in their multitudes.
The library offers a whole multitude of books for young readers.
It was an elite that believed its task was to enlighten the multitude.
to ensure the multitude is/are fed and entertained
He preached to the assembled multitude.

definitions.definition: to hide the real situation or facts when these are not good or pleasant

examples.text: It's a shabby old sofa but cushions and throws can hide a multitude of sins.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin multitudo, from multus ‘many’.
